New Records: Luka Modric became the oldest goalscorer in Euros history
Mattia Zaccagni’s 98th-minute goal is the second-latest goal scored in a game at the Euros (excluding extra time)
Key Match Events: Modric's penalty was saved by Donnarumma
Modric scored in the 33rd second after his penalty miss
Zaccagni scored the winning goal in added time
Pre-Game Insights: Croatia needed to win to make it through to the knockout stages
Italy beat Albania 2-1 in their opening game
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Modric needn't have worried as Zaccagni scored 33 seconds later
Modric's goal looked like it had given him an opportunity to extend his national team record further this summer
Zaccagni's goal might have spelled the end of Luka Modric's international career
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bastoni's powerful header from Nicolò Barella’s cross was brilliantly saved by Livakovic
Donnarumma saved four of his last seven penalties faced at the Euros
Others: The match was played at Leipzig Stadium in Germany
This is just the second time Croatia have failed to win any of their group games at an edition of the UEFA European Championship finals
